required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LSA Reconstruction With Laser Fenestration During the TEVAR
clinical_study.official_title: Left Subclavian Artery (LSA) Reconstruction With Laser-assisted Fenestration During the TEVAR Procedure for Type B Aortic Dissection

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the feasibility, effectiveness, and safety of in-situ laser-assisted fenestration on the left subclavian artery during the TEVAR procedure for Type B Aortic Dissection (TBAD).

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a single-arm, prospective study. All patients with type B aortic dissection (TBAD) present with the proximal tear site located approximately close to the left subclavian artery and a reconstruction of the left subclavian artery is necessary are included in the present study. During the procedure of thoracic artery endovascular repair (TEVAR), the left subclavian artery will be reconstructed with laser-assisted fenestration and the fenestrated stent will be fluency (BD company).

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from all-cause reintervention, all-cause mortality and major adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Freedom from all-cause reintervention, all-cause mortality and major adverse events

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with TBAD treated with TEVAR
arm_group.description: In situ laser assisted fenestration for the left subclavian artery during the TEVAR procedure for TBAD.

intervention.description: In situ laser assisted fenestration for the left subclavian artery during the procedure of TEVAR for type B aortic dissection
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with TBAD treated with TEVAR

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University
